articles.title: Trial to begin over Kobe Bryant helicopter crash photos
articles.description: Kobe Bryant's widow, Vanessa, is seeking unspecified millions in compensation for snapshots taken of the NBA star's corpse that were circulated after he was killed in a helicopter crash with their daughter and seven others in 2020.
articles.content: LOS ANGELES -- An invasion of privacy trial against the Los Angeles County sheriff's and fire departments begins Wednesday in a U.S. District Court just over a mile from where Kobe Bryant played for … [+2190 chars]

articles.title: World Cup set to start a day earlier with Qatar vs. Ecuador moved forward to Nov. 20 - sources
articles.description: The 2022 World Cup is set to start a day early with FIFA expected to move Qatar vs. Ecuador to Sunday, Nov. 20, sources have confirmed to ESPN.
articles.content:
The 2022 World Cup is set to start a day earlier than planned with FIFA expected to move Qatar's opening game to Sunday, Nov. 20, sources have confirmed to ESPN.

articles.title: Los Angeles Angels' Shohei Ohtani joins Babe Ruth as only players in MLB history to have at least 10 HRs and 10 wins in same season
articles.description: Angels two-way star Shohei Ohtani picked up his 10th win Tuesday night in Oakland to go with his team-leading 25th home run, joining Babe Ruth as the only players in major league history to have at least 10 home runs and 10 wins in the same season.
articles.content: OAKLAND, Calif. -- Shohei Ohtani withstood another injury scare and pitched six scoreless innings to go with his team-leading 25th home run, reaching yet another monumental milestone as the Los Angel… [+1640 chars]

articles.title: Dropped call -- Pirates infielder Rodolfo Castro has phone fly from back pocket during slide into third
articles.description: Called up from Triple-A before the game, Pirates infielder Rodolfo Castro slid headfirst into third base in the fourth inning against the Diamondbacks on Tuesday night and had his phone fly out of his back pocket.
articles.content:
PHOENIX -- Pittsburgh Pirates second baseman Rodolfo Castro apparently can't go anywhere without his phone.
Called up from Triple-A Indianapolis before the game, Castro slid headfirst into third in … [+995 chars]

articles.title: Oklahoma little league batter consoles tearful opposing pitcher after being hit in head during LLWS qualifier
articles.description: In a dramatic scene at a Little League regional tournament game Tuesday in Texas, batter Isaiah Jarvis walked to the mound to comfort opposing pitcher Kaiden Shelton after the right-hander's pitch slammed into Jarvis' helmet, sending him to the ground.
articles.content:
WACO, Texas -- A little league batter rose after being hit in the head to console the upset pitcher who threw the pitch during a Little League regional tournament game Tuesday in Waco, Texas.

articles.title: Federal judge rejects bid by three LIV golfers to compete in FedEx Cup playoffs
articles.description: A federal judge on Tuesday denied a temporary restraining order to three golfers who were seeking to participate in the FedEx Cup Playoffs after leaving the PGA Tour for the upstart LIV Golf Invitational Series.

articles.title: How Juan Soto became a San Diego Padre -- inside the biggest deal in baseball history
articles.description: It took weeks of maneuvering and hours of discussion -- and still hit an Eric Hosmer-related hiccup at the end. But by the afternoon of Aug. 2, baseball history was made.
